description: A flag when set to true, limits this operation to only creating new document delivery types and prevents data updates. Set the flag to 1 for add only purposes. Set the flag to 0, or leave it blank to allow updates.

Document_Delivery_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Document_Delivery_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Document_Delivery_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Contains references to Document Delivery Type work set.

Document_Delivery_Type_Data.description: A unique identifier for the Document Delivery Type.

A flag when set to true, sets the delivery method for a given document delivery type to default.Workday requires you to set 1 document delivery type as default and you must specify all document types available for a given delivery method.

validation.validation: You can't set Delivery Method of Integration as a default delivery type. To create the new document delivery type, set the Default Type flag to false.
You can't set a default document delivery type to Inactive.
Ensure to specify all Document Types available for the default Delivery Method.

Document_Delivery_Type_Data.description: A unique name for the Document Delivery Type. This field is required and must have a value.

validation.validation: Specify a unique name for the Delivery Type.

Delivery_MethodObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Delivery_MethodObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Delivery_MethodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Document_Delivery_Type_Data.description: The reference to the Delivery Method associated with the Document Delivery Type. Can either be Email or Mail delivery method.  This field is required and must have a value.

Communication_Usage_BehaviorObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Communication_Usage_BehaviorObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Communication_Usage_BehaviorObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Document_Delivery_Type_Data.description: The reference to the Document associated with the Document Delivery Type. The document can be a Customer Invoice, Customer Statement, or Dunning Letter. This field is required and must have a value.
The comments for this Document Delivery Type.
A flag when set to true, prevents you from adding an inactive delivery type to a customer profile. But you can update the delivery type.

description: Contains Document Delivery Type data based on the specified request and dates.

validation.validation: You can't remove these document types because they are associated with a Delivery Type that's in use.
Specify a Document Type that's either a customer invoice, dunning letter, or customer statement. You can specify multiple documents.
You can only select Customer Invoice document when the Delivery Method is set to Integration. To configure Customer Statement or Dunning Letter, change the Delivery Method to Email or Mail.
Workday delivered tenanted data can't be inactive.
You can't change the Delivery Method because the associated Delivery Type is in use.
You can't set default type for this method as it's already exists. To create the new document delivery type, set the Default Type flag to false.
